prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom The object to be constructed is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system for the part. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.0, 0.2645). Creating the 2D sketch Create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of several loops, each with one or more curves. Loop 1 - Circle * Create a circle with its center at point (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.375. Loop 2 - Circle * Create a circle with its center at point (0.1931, 0.375) and a radius of 0.1413. Loop 3 - Two Arcs * Create the first arc with its start point at (0.2395, 0.5545), mid point at (0.3696, 0.5701), and end point at (0.5, 0.5834). * Create the second arc with its start point at (0.5, 0.5834), mid point at (0.3613, 0.6452), and end point at (0.2395, 0.5545). Loop 4 - Circle * Create a circle with its center at point (0.5425, 0.375) and a radius of 0.1497. Face 2 and Face 4 - Circles * Loops 2 and 4 represent circular faces in the sketch and are standalone circles. Face 1 and Face 3 - Arcs * Loops 1 and 3 represent arcs connecting points in the sketch to form the upper and lower circles for the tapered cylindrical object. Scaling the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch using the `sketch_scale` parameter of 0.75. Transforming the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector set in the coordinate system. Extruding the 3D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model using the specified extrusion depths (towards normal: 0.0569, opposite normal: 0.0, and with the provided sketch scale). The created part will become a new solid body. The length of the part is 0.75, the width is 0.75, and the height is 0.0569.</description>
